website_summaries.verdict: Whether your child is an aspiring engineer, a keen builder, or simply a curious tinkerer, this affordable little workshop allows kids to build “real” items and offers loads of learning opportunities.
pros: Interlocking Durafoam wood pieces allow kids to easily assemble real projects
Each piece has pre-cut holes so that finished projects can be secured with screws and nuts
Comes with a battery powered drill featuring sound and working drill bits
Realistic design includes an easy to follow woodworking blueprint, spring action vise, tool storage bin, and shelves
cons: Some owners felt that the drill action is a little weak

customer_reviews.title: Quality toy but pointless
customer_reviews.text: Not very fun. The foam "wood" cutouts can connect together to create things, but the screws, hammer, drill gun, and screw driver are all useless and serve no function. The screws, for example, are a struggle to insert into holes in the "wood" pieces. And the toy drill gun didn't help either. My daughter used the toy hammer to bang on things around the house, but that was it. What we thought would be a fun birthday present ended up being a complete dud. We promptly returned. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: They very nicely sent a new set so we just had to ...
customer_reviews.text: Heads up! We had drill problems! I purchased this for my 4 year old grandson. The battery operated drill did not work! I contacted Amazon. They very nicely sent a new set so we just had to return the other set. The drill did work. Meanwhile, I contacted the manufacturer and purchased another drill set which included the battery operated drill and the basic tools. That drill only worked if you taped the battery compartment shut. I contacted that company and they sent another drill which did work. A lot of work for a play tool set!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SUPER COOL TOY!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so cool. We got it for our daughters 2nd birthday. She loves to hammer and drill like mommy and daddy. Its definitely a toy a kid could have for many years. She enjoys it now and will continue to enjoy it more when she is old enough to read the blueprints and build different things.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: I'm annoyed by non working parts and parts that don't fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Put this together Christmas day for my 3 yr old..guess what..drill doesn't work. Shocking, I know. I called the company...38 callers ahead of me...probably all needing working drills according to the reviews here. I sent an email and and if no response in a couple days, I'm going to go through amazon. Putting the legs together with the shelf was ridiculously hard, I had to use a screwdriver and all my body weight to kinda get it halfway in enough to stay together. My daughter loves it, I'm annoyed by non working parts and parts that don't fit together well. If I had to do it again, I'd spend the extra $10-$15 for the all wood work bench I saw.
customer_reviews.author: J Mahn

customer_reviews.title: Great for little helpers
customer_reviews.text: My son has used this for about six months and loves it! He’s now three-and-a-half. He uses the screw driver and saw much more than the foam pieces. The fake foam boards just stay in the bottom shelf, but he uses the tools to “fix things” around the house. The spinning screw driver is a cool feature. Worth the buy if you have a little helper at home.
customer_reviews.author: Katie L.

customer_reviews.title: His favorite is the drill
customer_reviews.text: My 21 month old son loves it! His favorite is the drill. I was highly impressed with all the foam wood projects he'll get to work on when he's older. He was only 19 months when we got it for him. SUCH a great work station and he gets to feel like he's doing stuff just like his daddy. VERY happy with this purchase and I got it for a good price, I thought.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kennel

customer_reviews.title: Great item for grandparents house
customer_reviews.text: We bought this 4 years ago to entertain our 2 year old grandson. At 6 years old he still lives it. The drill works great for us and is a favorite. There is a variety of foam wood and the kids use it to build lots of things, but not from the plans. Only I use the plans. Lol. Still is in great shape
customer_reviews.author: Mid Columbia Insulation LLC

customer_reviews.title: SO HAPPY WITH PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: Despite most of the negative reviews about this product, I bought it for Christmas for my 3 year old son. He LOVES it. Easy to put together & everything works. Being able to build his own things is what he loves the most❤️
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia Bessette

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy but my son who is 2 1/2 years old found it very difficult to get the hang of multiple pieces so my 9 year old has to help him it may be a little while before he can follow the designs but the frame of the work area is sturdy and looks super cute!
customer_reviews.author: Earth Mom Blog

customer_reviews.title: A Huge Hit For A Little Guy's Birthday!
customer_reviews.text: I figured this might be a great gift for a 4-year old and boy, was I right! He just loves this thing and spends almost all of his time playing with it. The foam "wood' pieces provide lots of variety and it's amazing how creative he can be with this set. Except for the drill, this workbench doesn't make much noise, but that doesn't matter... he proudly and loudly provide his own sound effects as he works away. It's a joy to watch him play with this!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Brown

customer_reviews.title: 1 out 3 drill bits work on plastic screws.
customer_reviews.text: The table itself is flimsy. It collapsed on my three year old son after he put hardly any weight on it. The puzzle pieces are a lot of fun. My daughter loves making the different models. The phillips and square drill bits do not fit on the screws. This was very disappointing as only the flat head drill bit will work on the screws. The other drill bits are too small.
customer_reviews.author: Hizic

customer_reviews.title: Very poor drawer design
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my three year-old grandson for Christmas and just finished putting it together. It's pretty much as advertised with one big exception. The drawer under the workbench where the tools are stored is too wide for the slots and is impossible for a three year old to slide out. I have to put one had on the bench while pulling on the drawer with the other hand. Would be interested to hear if others who have bought this found the same problem. Will have to figure out something to narrow the drawer before Thursday. I triple checked the assembly to make sure it was assembled as described.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lynch

customer_reviews.title: move along people, nothing to see here.
customer_reviews.text: I know the description said it would come in a damaged box and all parts would be included but one of the legs is cracked open and the drawer is busted. was expecting way higher quality out of step2 the plastic is a fraction as thick as the other step2 toys we have. very cheaply made. I would avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: Sergeant whiskers

customer_reviews.title: Toy bench broke first day
customer_reviews.text: I loved the look of this Toy Workshop with all the little building pieces etc but the side of the top broke when my 2 1/2 year old hit the side of the bench by the vice with the little hammer. That shouldn't have happened. I was happy with everything else. Just feel it doesn't deserve more than 2 stars breaking the day he got it. This was what he asked for for Christmas. Had to duct tape where it broke so he doesn't get hurt touching the top of the bench now. Cute bench just not very well made. Disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Lia

customer_reviews.title: Falls appart
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old grandson for Christmas. He loves it, but it will not stay together. Bottom shelf fits into the sides, and the hole is too big. I have tried to look on line to find a way to fix it, nothing yet. It is also unstable, it moves from side to side when playing on it and then it collapses. I need to call the manufacturer, and find out what is going on. It would be helpful if Amazon was involved. The bench It is not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old "working man" for Christmas. He loves it! He loves that he can build things all on his own and is very proud of himself! Would definitely recommend. I wish some of the foam pieces were duplicated so he could build more projects without having to take apart other projects for the correct part.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Son is two. He has fun with it. Uses the drill like his daddy. Hammers away at the thing. Thought he’d play with it more than he has though. We’ve had it about 8 months now. Holds up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Msiff74Z

customer_reviews.title: Great little workshop for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas gift for our son. He absolutely loves it! The tools are great and the projects are fun and easy to build. I went to replace the sweep on our back door and he told me to wait until he could gather his tools so he could help...and he is 3! He really thinks he is a handyman now, but the tools are designed in a way that he can't do any damage or hurt himself or others if he "works" on other things in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and price. Compared to large toolbenches this has so much more creative play. With the foam boards my kids have been building things not on blueprint. Such a great added feature
customer_reviews.author: Holly A. Turissini

customer_reviews.title: Not as fun as I expected
customer_reviews.text: But it’s as a Christmas gift and it was fine but not as fun as I had expected it to be. The wooden Foam piece Were flimsy amd cheap. and some of them were missing. It would be hard for my four-year-old daughter to do this on her own
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect, in allowing her to fine tune her fine ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter because she loves to pretend to play with tools, since she sees her dad building something with power tools. This is perfect, in allowing her to fine tune her fine motor schools while having fun! Size is great and reasonably priced! Lot of parts and pieces to keep your toddler entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Chan

customer_reviews.title: This may very well be the perfect little person's work bench
customer_reviews.text: This may very well be the perfect little person's work bench. I looked at all available models. This one has everything you need - tools, a vice, even blue prints to make things. The real kicker is that it comes with "faux" wood that the kids can make things out of (I.e. foam pieces) from the attached blue prints. I love that it isn't huge and doesn't take up a lot of space. We all know, kids lose interest in toys and this doesn't cost us a lot of real estate if and when that happens.
customer_reviews.author: Namaste

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: We put this tool bench together in less than 15 minutes for my 3 year old. Her and my 7 year old (both girls) absolutely love it. I bought it for them because they love following daddy around the house watching him fix things and try to borrow his tools. This was a good way to make them feel included and keep them safe. The "wooden" pieces are a foam type material and they don't hold up much to a child that likes to chew on things, but other than that, this was a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Tmama

customer_reviews.title: get it
customer_reviews.text: great toy. so incredibly easy to assemble... literally takes 5 -10 minutes. absolutely wonderful. my son is 2 and loves the power tool (how cool is that!). as he gets older, i can see us having lots of fun using the pieces to make things. there are a lot of pieces... more than expected. great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Kil

customer_reviews.title: My 3 yr old grandsons favorite gift this Christmas hands down
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr old grandsons favorite gift this Christmas hands down. He just loves it. I can't recall the age rating, but based on size I'd say kids 2 1/2 - 5. At 3, it's perfect for him size wise.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Hunter

customer_reviews.title: My son very much loved this christmas present
customer_reviews.text: My son very much loved this christmas present. It was fairly easy to put together. I heard it was durable. Wellll...my two year old is a hulk. So strong. Like he moves around our funiture strong. We have a pullout bed couch that we can barely lift and he scoots it all over. Anyways he can get this bench apart but he and I can get it back together with no harm. So it is actually the most hulk proof thing ever.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Jones

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Using in my Kindergarten classroom. Students are enjoying making "inventions" during free center play.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Petree

customer_reviews.title: sturdy bench for a 2yr old but needs more bells ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2yr old grandson hardly plays with this. We mostly just use it to put toys on. Not enough on it or with it to keep him entertained. I thought he'd get more use out of it when I purchased it. But he does not. It is a strong, sturdy bench for a 2yr old but needs more bells & whistles & gadgets to have him play on it
customer_reviews.author: Ann Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Too much $ for too little😕
customer_reviews.text: The advertising was a little amplified in the since that screws were missing. The original packaging was taped together like they pulled it out of the garbage. I am very unhappy, at least if they were going to sell it they should have sold it at a garage sale for $20 or under. I don't want to take it from my 1 & 3 year old. Perhaps I should have opened it earlier and returned it prior to them seeing it😕
customer_reviews.author: cochelle

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Toy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 3-year-old son for his birthday. From what I've seen of other workbench toys, the quality is very high. Constructed it in about 10 minutes, everything snapped together just fine, and the tools have held up to his play. The foam bits for the fake wood are fine but not that interesting. He did enjoy screwing the bolts in and routinely carries around his tools whenever he sees me working on something.
customer_reviews.author: Jarick Losey

customer_reviews.title: Great value, great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product my 3 year old and 5 year old both have hours of fun. The “wooden” pieces really make it more then just a work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Janell

customer_reviews.title: But the pieces are soft foam easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned with all the pieces that was included. But the pieces are soft foam easy to put together. My boys love them.
customer_reviews.author: MEC

customer_reviews.title: Great toy so far
customer_reviews.text: This toy has kept both my 4 year old and my 1 year old occupied for hours. The 4 year old makes projects and the 1 year old puts screws and things in and out of the holes on the toy itself. The only downside is that there are so many pieces. I understand that is the nature of the toy but with 2 little boys, those pieces do not stay with the toy, they get scattered. We have a closeable bin to hold everything when they aren't playing.
customer_reviews.author: finecon

customer_reviews.title: A toddler builder's joy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our two year old's Christmas and he loves it. You have to assemble it yourself, which is kind of a pain as the instructions are not very clear. But once it's up, you forget about the difficulties assembling it. It comes with lots of little pieces that my son likes: a scredriver with two different "bits" that can actually screw screws into the work bench or through little foam building blocks. You also get a vice grip and a hammer and a little toolbox for carrying materials. Our son has spent hours working on "projects" and "fixing stuff".
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Grandson's 3rd Birthday
customer_reviews.text: I checked around online and the big box stores and this was the best made in my opinion and at a reasonable price. He has seen his dad and papa working on a project and would pick up a tool and say, "I'm working". He loves it and though he has lots of toys, he always comes back to his tools and workbench. Still holding up well a year later and he hasn't lost any of the tools either. Would recommend for any child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toy Workbench
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my two-year-old grandson for Christmas. He loves making projects and particularly enjoys playing with the battery-operated drill.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product and a great deal for the print. It comes with all the parts a child would want to use with it and has all the storage needed for all the pieces. The blueprints to the child to follow are a great addition. The workbench was not the easiest to put together, however it seems like it will be sturdy and will last for a few years with my two children. We love how compact it is and how it does not take up too much space.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Best toy workbench out there
customer_reviews.text: This workbench is just wonderful! My three-year-old daughter loves being able to use tools just like daddy and mommy. She enjoys using the drill by herself and building the little toys with help. The workbench also makes a great kitchen in her imaginary games. :) I am very happy with this purchase. I think this is the best toy workbench out there.
customer_reviews.author: PittmanOfLaMancha

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for quite awhile, my son still loves it and he's 7. Easy to assemble, just wish the big sticker would've been put on by someone not as picky as I am. I got a wrinkle in it and it annoys me every time I see it. Fun, creative, etc. Great gift for little ones.
customer_reviews.author: samantha causseaux

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes you take a big plunge of a guess when you buy something when you can't 'see' it... But Step 2 is usually a good name and good product, this workshop bench was no exception. This was for our three year old nephew and reportedly it went together simply and it's become a real 'go to' toy for him. Some boys are tinkerers at birth, and he is such---and so, if you have one of these wee carpenters in your home, I think you'll be getting extra lovin' for such a sweet gift!
customer_reviews.author: ClubFisher

customer_reviews.title: I got this to get my granddaughter started on working ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to get my granddaughter started on working on things. It's basic and she's a little young yet (2.5 yrs) to really get into it. But I'm hopeful that we can grow into a real workshop in the next few years.
customer_reviews.author: WB9RRO

customer_reviews.title: Feels “real”
customer_reviews.text: Great, my 19 mo old son really entertains himself with it.
customer_reviews.author: PattyCastro

customer_reviews.title: It's great and affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and the tools are life-like and having the foam pieces and instructions to build things makes it better than all the others I have seen. The only downside is that the tools can't drill the plastic screws through the foam pieces and you have to push them in by hand, but no biggie at all. You can still use the drill to screw the screws into the table itself so that they still get to feel like they are drilling.
customer_reviews.author: A. Reidy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy!!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously my little guy LOVES this. So cute and fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for little builders.
customer_reviews.text: A little small for my 4yr old but it's sturdy and comes with tons of little building blocks. Very happy with this set!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: My 2-year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I searched everywhere for a good work bench for my son's 2nd birthday. Most were very small or very cheaply made. This workshop is the perfect size and it is very sturdy. We have had this a few months and it has lasted very well against his banging and beating on the toy. The tools are pretty good quality also and look as if they will last for quite awhile. I'm very pleased with this workshop. Very good product and good price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Kids Workshop I've Bought
customer_reviews.text: We've had a couple other kids work benches, and this is easily the best one, and also the cheapest of the ones we've had. As for the reviews on here that complain about durability, I think they have to realize that these are plastic children's toys. Of course it will be a little wobbly, but it's not like you are cutting real 2 by 4's on it. I bought it for my 2 year old, but my 7 year old plays with it about as much as the 2 year old. The older one loves building things with the "wood" pieces, and the 2 year old loves just drilling and hammering. We are very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed with the quality. Drill bits dont fit into the drill properly and are constantly falling out. Also, was this supposed to come with screws to attach the vice? Because there are none. My son is 2.5 and still enjoys playing with this workbech and pretending to build. I would not recommend to someone else though.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Fun fun fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old grandson loved it! The wood pieces are safe for a youngster...soft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun workbench
customer_reviews.text: Well built product. My daughter really enjoyed playing with it. I think she maybe a little too young to follow all of the instructions but she finds using the tools, nuts and bolts, and other items fun. I do wish that the girl was a tad bit stronger as it often cuts out when she is working on certain items with it. Overall a good educational product for kids to play with.
customer_reviews.author: KNakano

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic toy!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this, especially the drill. The blocks are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Eli Newton

customer_reviews.title: Dexterity building
customer_reviews.text: Great for kids who want to help Dad in the garage. Builds up dexterity, hammering, using plastic bolts and wrenches etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Cute toy, damaged box and missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: We received this and the box was damaged but all the parts were fine, so we kept it. Now that I’m assembling, we are missing the instructions for assembling the toy itself (found them online) and for the little foam building pieces, as well as all the stickers. I will contact step2 on Monday to see if they can send the missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Friddle

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this comes with so much cool stuff ..definitely a good investment
customer_reviews.author: Wayne W.

customer_reviews.title: My daycare kids just love this workshop and they love building with the pretend ...
customer_reviews.text: My daycare kids just love this workshop and they love building with the pretend wood pieces as a matter of fact they enjoy the wood pieces most of all. I was wondering if you sell just the pretend wood pieces as a pack, I just don't have enough to go around, I too love building things with them. I've tried to see if I could find the pretend wood but no such luck.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn W.

customer_reviews.title: My grandson loves it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had a problem with the drill not working and was sent a whole 2nd item for a replacement and my grandson 3-1/2 years old loves it. Great for hand and eye coordination. Fitting pieces together using a map of pieces. Pieces are well made and flexable. It is like building puzzles. My grandson was able to build items by himself within 1 week. Great for building self confedence.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Steen

customer_reviews.title: Fun for our Boys
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on other reviews, and I see why people like this one. The pieces kept my kids' attention (ages 3 and 6) and it was fun to make toys out of this toy. My 6-year-old was able to figure out how to make the birdhouse, toolbox and cube without any trouble, and my 3-year-old loved the drill and saw. I recommend this for young children (no older than around age 6). It gets 4 stars instead of 5 because it did not include enough of the red screws and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Byelich

customer_reviews.title: The quality is good
customer_reviews.text: The quality is good, but the design is not good enough
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Great Fun
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 2.5 year old this holiday and he loves tools. However, he seems to have limited interest in it. When I get him going by creating things he gets interested again. Perhaps it is more suited for a little older children. But, the construction and quality are very good. And the activities are easy for a 2.5 year old to do with some assistance.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Langel

customer_reviews.title: My son wasn't too interested in it, In order ...
customer_reviews.text: My son wasn't too interested in it, In order for a child 4-5 to play with it, they need parental assistant.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Rae Olson

customer_reviews.title: 2 year old approved
customer_reviews.text: Drawer sticks a bit, and the projects on the back are a bit convoluted even for 3 years. But, My 2 1/2 year old loves to stand and play at this, so it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: kmontana

customer_reviews.title: nice play set for children
customer_reviews.text: got is for my niece as a birthday present, we've had so much fun putting things together. It's hands on, and it has instructions on how to build different objects. The pieces are durable yet not to hard so it's safe and great for children
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Harper

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad Except the Power Tools
customer_reviews.text: The power tool does not have a good battery connection. The kids love constructing with the foam wood shapes. The little vice works a little. It's ok, very sturdy and strong. I would recommend buying your own accessories (power tools) though.
customer_reviews.author: Rockin Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for our three year old nephew. Great way of introducing tools to young ones. Awesome little toys they build together.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Favorite for our two year old
customer_reviews.text: This and power tools were the big gifts last year. Provided good opportunities for our son to (sometimes reluctantly) share something he loved. Fun interlocking parts, but tools are the star. Son set records for how many tools he could carry in clothes, arms, mouth... I was worried about plastic durability, but this has stood up for us and I'm glad we got this set rather than real wood.
customer_reviews.author: Eric W

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 yr old if mom or dad helps
customer_reviews.text: Two-yr old granddaughter liked it. Pounded away. Probably more appropriate for 3 or 4...but still fun for 2 yr old. Get ready to pick up a lot of pieces, tho'. :-) Best if a grown-up works WITH the child.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Endless hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to put together and endless hours of fun!
customer_reviews.author: SweetAugust

customer_reviews.title: Very cool set
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves his new tool set! I love that there are actually things that he can put together and not just a bunch of plastic pieces that don't make anything.
customer_reviews.author: Tristin jones

customer_reviews.title: Got a rough 3 year old boy?
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr old is pretty rough on toys and the bench fell apart completely each time he leaned against it due to a poor fit between the table and right leg. It's very cool but he's too young and I recommend supergluing the table to the legs if any parts don't fit correctly. 😞
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor

customer_reviews.title: Great toy and keeps the kids entertained!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my nephew's birthday and it was just as cool as it looks! He loves it so much and so does my son that I think I need to buy one for our house! The tools really work and it's so fun to build objects out of the foam wood pieces! I only wish we could purchase more foam wood pieces and an extra drill but I haven't come across that yet! [...]
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our nephew and he LOVED it! It has kept him busy for many hours now, and his parents love that they can help him build the included little foam projects (like the bird house). It was much sturdier than I thought it was going to be for the price, and I couldn't be any happier with it!
customer_reviews.author: Hawthy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, fun set
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves my power tools...now he's got his own power drill with this set! He likes putting the stuff together using all the little pieces. Just watch out, they are just the right consistency foam that dogs love to chew! Great set if your kids love to use tools and put stuff together.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: It's small
customer_reviews.text: It's not very big, but ok for our two year old. The activities (projects) are too hard for this age.
customer_reviews.author: Andreakicks

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: My 23 month old son seems to enjoy this toy quite a bit now, and I imagine he'll continue to enjoy it for a few years to come. My only problem with it is that the entire bench slides forward when he opens the tool drawer. I went to the hardware shop and purchased some anti-slide tabs for the bottom which made a big difference. I am surprised the manufacturer doesn't include them. Otherwise it's a great toy.
customer_reviews.author: H. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: So fun all three of my boys love it ages from 1 to 6
customer_reviews.author: chelsea vogel

customer_reviews.title: Foam workbenche !  Foam !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were real wood pieces to put together and was very disappointed to find foam. Not a good purchase at all
customer_reviews.author: LoriC.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gold-box deal for my nephew for Christmas. He absolutely loves it! Everywhere he goes he brings his drill with him. It is a very durable set and provides hours of entertainment. The price I paid made it even better. My sister tells me constantly how much fun he has using it. I highly recommend this to anyone who has kids that enjoy building and banging on things!
customer_reviews.author: MattRedna

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy I found this! I almost went with another one but a customer review regarding this one changed my mind. I'm so glad, I set this up in 15 minutes so easy & my son loves it. Thank you:)
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Tool workshop
customer_reviews.text: This was received on time and in perfect condition. This is a perfect gift for any 2yr old. My 2yr old grandson loves it. The power tools are fun and he shares with his 3yr old sister. There are plenty of pieces so that you can help him make many different projects. the picture shows the exact and accurate image of this toy. I can see already that there are many hours of play with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Flozee

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler work bench
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 4 year old grand son who loves to use tools. The item was shipped free from Amazon, saving me $17 in shipping. Item was quality and my grandson love it. He hammers on it all day long. Great product and great price and I looked at a ton of workbenches. I liked that he could put together squares and use the screwdriver. Great for motor skills!
customer_reviews.author: reen5horse

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 2.5 y.o son, now he is almost 3 and can build the projects himself. His older sister likes to help him)) the only thing i would like to be better - the screwdriver has a very weak motor, if it meets slight resistance, it stops turning.
customer_reviews.author: NinaNP

customer_reviews.title: Drill actually works!
customer_reviews.text: Nephew loves it. He beat on itnwith hammer and said “I fix it” for about three hours.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Davis

customer_reviews.title: Happy Grandson
customer_reviews.text: My grandson really enjoyed this toy. It is very age appropriate for a 3 year old. It was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping for deals

customer_reviews.title: Educational and uses a childs' imagination.
customer_reviews.text: My great grandson loves his tool bench. Occupies him for a long time and is proud of his accomplishments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some of the foam pieces stay connected as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: Some of the foam pieces stay connected as well as they should but overall my son enjoys playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: A year later and great in great shape and my two year old still plays with it!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Burger

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: My husband does a lot of woodworking and other construction projects. My 3 year old loves to watch and always wants to steal daddy's tools. Little tools are cute, the wood pieces are great for little guy imaginations and seems to hold up to all the punishment that a toddler can dish out. Great buy at a much cheaper price than many of the other brands names of construction sets.
customer_reviews.author: A.Dub.Alva

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: it was a great gift and
customer_reviews.text: this was exactly what we were looking for! it was a great gift and sturdy

customer_reviews.title: Fun for 18month +
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, and kid friendly. My daughter loves building and playing with the tools

customer_reviews.title: The workbench is cute but the drill overheated and melted ...
customer_reviews.text: The workbench is cute but the drill overheated and melted the battery. Thankfully I was playing with my daughter and noticed it but it is a major safety concern.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Maycock

customer_reviews.title: Great kids toy
customer_reviews.text: Kids got it for Christmas last year and have loved it... especially being able to make things from the foam pieces its kept them busy for hours. This was the most used piece of the Workshop
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Memery

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our four young grandsons (age 1-5) and they love it! It was easy to assemble, is very sturdy, and we are all enjoying playing with it, adults and kids alike! I highly recommend this toy!
customer_reviews.author: John Weiss

customer_reviews.title: It is cool because you can actually build things with the "wood"
customer_reviews.text: My son likes it! It is cool because you can actually build things with the "wood", which is made of foam by the way, not actual wood. It comes with some cool tools and is quite sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: kristen leslie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Grandson loves it, can't put drill down. Probably slept with it in his hand
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: MISSING PIECES DO NOT ORDER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received the product and the foam projects, tool set, and vise were not included. VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Blaine Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: It's not to big and not too small. I love how it comes with so many pieces and the pictured direction to make many different things with the wood colored foam pieces. I just which it had may be a wrench or some other tools with it but my kids both 5 and 2 love playing and making stuff with it
customer_reviews.author: Atkinskid

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3 year old boy and he loves it. The workbench is easy to put together and I can see how the tools can help with hand eye coordination. My only complaint is that the battery powered drill seems a bit inconsistent. It would spin fine at times, and then all of a sudden seem like it is out of power,....and then get powered up again. I'm not sure if this has to do with the wiring inside the drill, but it seems a bit cheap. Other than the drill, everything else is well made and fun for my son.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Step2 Real Projects Workshop ...
customer_reviews.text: Shipment arrived on time. Description was exactly as seller described. I was please with item great for kids helps them to developed in their motor skills. This is a great toy also. I would order again from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: betty

customer_reviews.title: One of this year's favorite Christmas presents
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 1/2 year-old grandson for Christmas. He loves it--especially the ability to make things from the foam "wood" pieces. Within a couple of weeks, he had already completed several "projects." It now holds all of his "tool" collection, and I believe it will prove to be one of those toys that "grow" with the child for several years to come.
customer_reviews.author: marianne

product_meta.title: Step2 Real Projects Toy Workshop With Tools
product_meta.description:
3 years & up. Encourage creativity with realistic-looking Durafoam "wood" that provides unlimited building possibilities. "Wood" pieces assemble easily with interlocking notches and holes to add screws and nuts; helps develop hand-eye coordination. Sturdy table has built-in spring-action vise and work surface that features holes to accommodate screws, recesses for tool storage, and an adjustable angle finder. Includes an electronic drill (requires 2 "AA" batteries, not included), 3 drill bits, 1 universal holder, 8 screws, 8 nuts, saw, hammer, and 42 Durafoam "wood" pieces. Measures 35 1/8"H x 22 3/4"W x 14 1/2"D. Encourage busy hands to learn to build with a new Real Projects Workshop. This great activity bench includes a conveniently-sized work bench, realistic "wood" foam building pieces, and tools to assemble them.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Encourage busy hands to learn to build with a new Real Projects Workshop. This great activity bench includes a conveniently-sized work bench, realistic "wood" foam building pieces, and tools to assemble them.
feature_bullets: A toy tool bench for toddlers with tools, a built-in vice, pull out storage, and 2 shelves to hold building supplies.
Work bench surface features holes to accommodate screws, play tool storage and an adjustable angle-finder
Kids will love the pretend battery powered drill with realistic sounds and interchangeable drill bits.
Comes with blue prints and Durafoam pretend 'wood' projects (birdhouse, airplane, boat, tool caddy)
Includes a 65-piece accessory set: Pretend hammer, drill, saw, toy wood pieces, nuts, bolts, and nails.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars634 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
